trends: There have been 2 other sightings in Huntingdon
There were no other sightings in Huntingdon on or around August 26th 2009
divs: sighting detailstuesday, 25 august 2009 10:00 pm est - wednesday 26 august 2009 2:30 am est description: at approximately 10:10 pm i noticed an object in the sky, upon first glance it seemed like a star twinkling in the distance. there was an unusual red \ green coloration to the object which attracted my attention enough to retrieve binoculars. with closer inspection the binoculars revealed that the lights of the object were in a triangular pattern of red \ green \ amber. i called my wife to look at the object using another set of binoculars. she confirmed that there were actually lights in a triangular pattern. during this time (elapse 15 minutes) the object remained motionless at 302��� (nnw) from my original vantage point. we observed the object jointly for about thirty minutes relocating to a nearby field to obtain a better view. several aircraft passed close by our position, while the object remained motionless 20��� off the visible horizon. retiring to the house i re-observed the object at fifteen minute intervals, always noting that it was in the same position. at approximately 1:30 am the object dramatically changed, revealing three solid amber lights and a white strobe light (one second interval). after observing this for some time i returned to the house. upon returning for the last look (2:30 am), the object had reverted to its original lighting scheme of red \ green \ amber. the object never moved directionally during the entire viewing. equipment used: binocular m-17 artillery field glasses 7x50 jason model 1111 mercury 7x35
